qas.question: What was the subject of the front page on 22 September 2003?
Who was featured in the article on mental health?
What was the original headline on 22 September 2003?
What was the headline changed to after public backlash?
What had happened to Frank Bruno to spur the publishing of a story about him?

context: On 22 September 2003 the newspaper appeared to misjudge the public mood surrounding <a0_0>mental health<a0_0/>, as well as its affection for former world heavyweight champion boxer <a1_0>Frank Bruno<a1_0/>, who <a4_0>had been admitted to hospital<a4_0/>, when the headline "<a2_0>Bonkers Bruno Locked Up<a2_0/>" appeared on the front page of early editions. The adverse reaction, once the paper had hit the streets on the evening of 21 September, led to the headline being changed for the paper's second edition to the more sympathetic "<a3_0>Sad Bruno In Mental Home<a3_0/>".
